title: JOUR JOUR 322-0-20 Storytelling: Video Reporting, Shooting, & Editing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This Medill class is designed to teach video storytelling in preparation for your journalism residency placement and beyond. The course will emphasize a variety of research, writing and field reporting techniques that will prepare you for the challenges of working in a professional newsroom where video is emphasized. In addition, we will consider in practice the ethical implications of reporting, shooting, editing and producing live shots for visual media. Deadline work will also be incorporated in some assignments. Students will practice their on-camera skills primarily in the field.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
This course is reserved for pre-JR students. For those students who wish to take this course as an elective, available seats may be released to CAESAR registration after pre-JR students have been enrolled.

Students who are assigned to take this course in a later quarter should NOT register themselves for this course.
